benchmark_details.name: MENTAL MANIP
benchmark_details.overview: MENTAL MANIP is a dataset consisting of 4,000 annotated movie dialogues for the fine-grained analysis of mental manipulation in conversations, designed to assist in the detection and classification of manipulative language and the vulnerabilities targeted in victims.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To identify and classify mental manipulation in dialogues for better understanding and mitigation of its impact in conversations.

data.annotation: Annotated by 17 college students through a multi-level taxonomy involving extensive guidelines and training

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using standard classification evaluations based on predictions vs. true labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in accuracy, precision, and recall indicate better model performance on identifying manipulation.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through inter-annotator agreement scores and model performance on test sets.

targeted_risks.harm: The dataset includes sensitive content which poses risks if used for malicious purposes.
